page.title: 06CLATFORD SCHOOL
page.content: The school in Goodworth Clatford serves three villages,Anna Valley, Upper Clatford and Goodworth Clatford itself. The building was hit by a stray flying bomb in 1944, and it was rebuilt in 1963 to house 90 children. There are now 158 children in the school.The original land of the school was given by W.H.Iremonger Esq.and the Vicar and churchwarden were trustees It is still a church aided{SCHOOL}in the state{EDUCATION}system.There is a headmaster and five teachers.Also there is a part time secretary and one non{TEACHING}assitant.The school provides dinners for those who require them.Two cooks and three supervising assistants are employed.There are between 30 and 35{CHILDREN}in each class,we have two computers which are in use every day.
